title: Collective Mind, Part II: Towards Performance- and Cost-Aware Software Engineering as a Natural Science
abstract: Nowadays, engineers have to develop software often without even knowing which hardware it will eventually run on in numerous mobile phones, tablets, desktops, laptops, data centers, supercomputers and cloud services. Unfortunately, optimizing compilers are not keeping pace with ever increasing complexity of computer systems anymore and may produce severely underperforming executable codes while wasting expensive resources and energy.
histories: Presented at the 18th International Workshop on Compilers for Parallel Computing (CPC'15), London, UK
